item.ptxt: Use the same procedure for the RH and LH sides.
The procedure listed below is for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT FRONT STABILIZER LINK ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the nut and disconnect the stabilizer link from the lower arm.

atten4.ptxt: If the ball joint turns together with the nut, use a 6 mm hexagon wrench to hold the stud in place.

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT FRONT STABILIZER LINK ASSEMBLY RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.

s2.ptxt: Remove the front stabilizer bar from the vehicle body.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT SHOCK ABSORBER WITH COIL SPRING

atten4.ptxt: While fixing the nut in place, loosen and remove the bolt.

s2.ptxt: Remove the 3 nuts and shock absorber with coil spring.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT SUPPORT TO FRONT SHOCK ABSORBER NUT

s2.ptxt: Attach the arm of SST to the diameter of the coil spring.

item.ptxt: Make sure that the coil spring is installed so that the distance between the upper and lower hooks of SST is at the maximum.
Make sure that the claws of the hooks are securely attached.

s2.ptxt: Using SST, compress the coil spring.

item.ptxt: If the coil spring bends during the compression, immediately stop the compression and reinstall SST.
Do not compress the spring until the coil springs contact each other.
Do not use an impact wrench.

s2.ptxt: Hold the shock absorber rod and remove the nut.

atten2.ptxt: Do not remove the nut when the coil spring is not free.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT SHOCK ABSORBER CUSHION RETAINER

s2.ptxt: Remove the cushion retainer from the shock absorber.
Remove the cushion from the shock absorber.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT SUSPENSION SUPPORT SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the suspension support from the shock absorber.
Remove the cushion retainer from the shock absorber.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT COIL SPRING UPPER INSULATOR LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the upper insulator from the coil spring.
Remove the coil spring from the shock absorber.
